name: Add missing AppleScript calls
body:
- Add `util.set_theme()`
- Add `util.action_in_alfred()`
- Add `util.browse_in_alfred()`
- Add `util.search_in_alfred()`
- Add `util.reload_workflow()`

name: Allow arbitrary HTTP methods
body:
- Add `web.delete()`
- Add `web.put()`
- Allow arbitrary HTTP method in `web.request()`
- Pretty-print JSON when Alfred's debugger is open

name: Fix Workflow.debugging in production
body: Ensure environment variables are encoded in unit tests.

name: Alfred 4 support
body:
Update and External Trigger APIs now know about Alfred 4.

- Add support for `.alfred4workflow` file extension to hide workflows from Alfred 3 and below.
- Replace AppleScript with JXA.
- Automatically call `Alfred 3` or `com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred` depending on the version of Alfred the library is running in.

name: Ensure util.appinfo() handles multiple apps with same bundle ID
body: - Make `util.appinfo()` not choke if multiple apps with the same bundle ID are installed #133

name: Fix updates
body: - Don't throw an exception if update finds no valid releases #132

name: Support for saving variables to info.plist/config sheet
body: Add support for Alfred's configuration API #125

name: Improve appinfo
body: Change `appinfo` to also work on non-running apps

name: Add new utility functions
body:
Helpers
-------

- Add new [utility functions for running commands and scripts](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/api/index.html#utilities-helpers)
- Move some helpers from `workflow.py` to `util.py`


Workflow
--------

- Write '.' to debugger on start, so real log messages start on a new line
- Use root logger instead of 'workflow'
- Add [`warn_empty()`](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/api/index.html#workflow.Workflow3.warn_empty) helper method to `Workflow3`

name: Item3 inherits variables from Workflow3
body: Ensures that top-level variables are also sent when a modifier is used

name: Ensure `run_in_background` waits for background process to start
body:
`is_running` now returns the correct status immediately #124 

Big thanks to @orf for identifying the problem and the solution.

name: Ensure existing session ID is loaded and preserved
Support for "match" field in Alfred 3.5
body: Support for [match](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/inputs/script-filter/json/#match) field in items added in Alfred 3.5 for [Alfred filters results](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/inputs/script-filter/#alfred-filters-results) option.

name: Set variables using new method in Alfred 3.4.1
body:
- Use new method of setting item/modifier variables introduced in Alfred 3.4.1 (currently in beta)
- Add alternative icons to modifiers
- Rejigger docs

name: Set workflow variables from Run Script actions
body: Add new `Variables` class to [set workflow variables from Run Script actions](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/workflow-variables.html#setting-variables-from-run-script-actions) #117

name: Properly handle .alfred3workflow files
body: Fix #115

name: Ensure update uses default serialiser
body: Fix #113

name: Fix hanging background processes on Sierra
body:
- Fix hanging background processes on Sierra #111 
- Remove stale lockfiles #110 
- Add [session IDs and session-scoped caching](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/guide/persistent-data.html#session-scoped-cache)

name: Alter log level depending on whether Alfred's debugger is open
body: Log level now defaults to INFO if Alfred's debugger is closed and DEBUG if it's open

name: Support top-level variables and "rerun" introduced in Alfred 3.2
body:
- Top-level (i.e. `Workflow.setvar()`) variables
- New `rerun` feature introduced in Alfred 3.

`rerun` tells Alfred to run your Script Filter again after the specified number of seconds. The new top-level variables are passed to the Script Filter when it's run again.

name: Optional plaintext error messages
body:
Thanks to #105 by @idpaterson, you can now force error messages (when `Workflow.run()` catches an exception) to be in plaintext, rather than Alfred's XML/JSON feedback format.

This is useful when your script isn't running in a Script Filter and you'd like to show the error message in a notification.

name: Fix hidden errors and tidy up
body:
This release has no new features, but removes a couple of potential errors.

**Note:** The signature of `workflow.update.install_update()` has changed. It no longer takes any arguments, as they weren't used anyway.

If you were calling this function directly, which is unlikely, you will need to update your workflow(s).

name: Add support for quicklookurl in feedback items.
body:
The `quicklookurl` feature is now supported in both `Workflow` and `Workflow3` classes.

Closes #100

name: Use workflow version in info.plist
body: Under Alfred 3, will now preferentially use the Workflow Version specified in Alfred's workflow configuration sheet (and `info.plist`). No `version` file necessary any more.

name: Workflow3 defaults to Alfred 3 directories
body: Improves behaviour when workflow scripts aren't run from Alfred and the corresponding environment variables aren't set.

name: BUGFIX: Remove errant debug print statement
body: Thanks to @fantomnotabene for #92

name: [BROKEN] BUGFIX: Remove errant debug print statement
[BROKEN] Workflow variables and advanced modifiers
body:
- Support for setting workflow variables via Script Filter feedback
- Support for Alfred 3's advanced modifiers

**Note:** Both these features are Alfred 3 only.

name: Add Alfred 3-only updates
body:
Use `.alfred3workflow` files in GitHub releases for Alfred 3-only workflows. This enables you to release backwards-incompatible versions without Alfred 2 installations trying to update themselves to death.

[Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/update.html#supporting-alfred-2-and-alfred-3)

name: Turn STDERR logging back on
body: Alfred 2 has been fixed.

name: Turn off STDERR logging to prevent hangs
body: Workaround for #80.

name: Allow auto-update to prerelease versions
body:
- Add prerelease option for updates #77
- Make writing of settings.json uninterruptible #79

Thanks to @idpaterson for the above new features

name: Force POST requests
body:
- #74 fixes long-standing issue that POST requests weren't POST requests without any data.

The unit tests have been heavily overhauled to use py.test and run entirely offline. This
makes the tests run on Travis CI again.

name: Handle mutable values properly in Settings
body:
- Fix broken handling of mutable values by Settings
- Ensure settings.json is only written when Settings has changed

name: Add notifications
body:
- Post notifications via Notification Center (10.8+ only)
- Change documentation theme to Alabaster
- Tidy up scripts

name: Add file locking around `settings.json`
body: Add file locking around `settings.json` to prevent overwriting by different processes (#69)

name: Improve data integrity
body:
- Prevent workflow from being killed while writing to disk #66
- Context manager and decorator to make your own code more resilient
- GET parameters from `params` and the URL are now combined in `web.py`
- Add project icon
- Add rudimentary Dash docset

name: No new features/bugfixes
body:
Fix a rendering problem of the description on PyPI.

Otherwise no changes. Release is only to maintain parity with PyPI version numbers.

name: Full support for OS X 10.6 and 10.7
body:
- #27 Fix compatibility with older versions of `security`
- #61 Python 2.6 compatibility for 10.6
- #62 Add 2.6 to Travis
- Ensure all test modules run without a special environment
- Use `tox` for tests

name: Filter bugfix and more robust handling of borked settings
body:
- #57 filter by `min_score` before `max_results`.
- #56 Accept empty string for `autocomplete`. If `autocomplete` is set to `""` (empty string), TABbing a result will autocomplete to the keyword

name: Add proper version support, dumb punctuation, help URL, first run/last run version
body:
Now with real version support
- #44: `help_url` for URL link to help/support page. Shown in error logs and via `workflow:help` magic arg. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/api/workflow.html#workflow.workflow.Workflow).
- #21: `Workflow.dumbify_punctuation()` replaces curly and other exotic quotes, n- and m-dashes with ASCII equivalents. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/api/workflow.html#workflow.workflow.Workflow.dumbify_punctuation).
- #30: Turn automatic update checks off/on with `workflow:noautoupdate` and `workflow:autoupdate`. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/magic-arguments.html).
- #32: Change magic arg prefix (`Workflow.magic_prefix`) and editing, augmenting of built-in magic args. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/magic-arguments.html#customising-magic-arguments).
- #40: Proper semantic version support. First run/last run version support to enable bootstrapping/migration. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/versioning.html).
- New magic args. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/magic-arguments.html).
  - `workflow:magic` lists all available magic args.
  - `workflow:help` opens `help_url` in default browser (if set).
  - `workflow:version` displays version of installed workflow (if set).

name: Go directly to v1.10.1. Do not pass Go, do not collect £200
body: This release has a fatal error :hankey:

name: Improved cache/data deletion; Save downloaded files directly to disk
body:
- #47 Cache and data files can be selectively deleted. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/persistent-data.html#clearing-cached-data).
- #52 Handle gzipped HTTP data
- #53 `save_to_path()` method added to save HTTP response data directly to a file. [Docs](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/api/web.html#workflow.web.Response.save_to_path).

name: Update icons for Yosemite
body:
- Remove `ICON_MUSIC` as it's no longer present in Yosemite.
- Add a few new system icons.
- Add `MANIFEST.in` so PyPI distribution works again.

name: Ignore releases marked "pre-release"
body:
GitHub releases marked as pre-releases will be ignored by the update code.

Thanks to @fniephaus for the addition.

name: Fix bug in update.py
body:
Previously, Alfred-Workflow would only recognise a workflow as having been update
for 60 seconds after the last update check.

name: Log workflow execution duration
body: Workflow execution speed is of the essence in Alfred, so `Workflow.run()` now always logs how long it took the workflow to execute.

name: Add self-updating ability
body:
If your workflow uses GitHub releases, with version 1.9 of Alfred-Workflow it will be able to update itself.

See [the documentation](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/user-manual/update.html) for information on setting up and using the self-updating feature.

Thanks to @fniephaus

name: Reorganise documentation
body:
Move documentation out of source code and into the docs.

Split docs into several smaller files.

Change theme to Read the Docs theme.

Mirror documentation on [Read the Docs](http://alfredworkflow.readthedocs.org/en/latest/).

name: Clarify behaviour of Workflow.filter()
body:
`Workflow.filter()` now raises a `ValueError` if `query` is empty or a blank string.

Improve and clarify documentation.

Documentation is now also available on [Read the Docs](http://alfredworkflow.readthedocs.org/en/latest/#) (beta).

name: Fix filter sort regression
body: Fix #34

name: Work from within non-ASCII directories
body: Fix bug #29 where non-ASCII characters in the path to the workflow's directory would cause `Workflow` to fail.

name: Add support for Large Type and Copy Text
body:
Add `largetext` and `copytext` arguments to `Workflow.add_item()`.

If Script Filter results have a specified `copytext`, this will be copied to the clipboard (instead of `arg`) when CMD+C is pressed on the item.

If results have a specified `largetext`, this will be shown in Alfred's large text pop-up (instead of the query) when CMD+L is pressed on the item.

name: Allow workflow.py to work from outside the workflow
body: This will enable Alfred-Workflow to be installed via pip and the bundler.

name: Improve encoding detection of HTTP resources
body:
- Better parsing of HTTP headers
- Better sniffing of HTML/XML document headers
- Better fallback default encodings for common mimetypes

name: Improve docs; make Settings.save() method public
body: Add improved documentation regarding settings, stored data, background processes

name: Add data storage methods and custom serializers
body:
- Add new `Workflow.store_data(name, data)` and `Workflow.stored_data(name)` methods.
- Add `SerializerManager` to enable custom serialization formats for stored and cached data.

Implements #17

name: Add support for Alfred 2.4's environmental variables
body:
See [this thread](http://www.alfredforum.com/topic/4716-some-new-alfred-script-environment-variables-coming-in-alfred-24/) for more information.

[Here](http://www.deanishe.net/alfred-workflow/workflow.html#workflow.workflow.Workflow.alfred_env) is Alfred-Workflow's corresponding documentation.

name: Allow duplicate items in `filter`
body: Fix #15

name: Add `iter_content` method to web.py
body: Implement #14

name: Enable deletion of individual cache files
body:
By passing `None` as the data argument to `Workflow.cache_data()`, you can force the deletion of the corresponding cache file:

```
from workflow import Workflow
wf = Workflow()
wf.cache_data('test', None)
```

will delete the cache file for name/key `test`.

This may be useful in forcing your workflow to update its cache data.

name: Revert default filter matching to MATCH_ALL
Add support for modifier subtitles
body: You can now specify subtitles to be shown when modifier keys are pressed

name: Fix duplicate log messages
body: No more duplicate messages in the log file if your workflow instantiates multiple `Workflow` instances.

name: Add background tasks
body:
### New features 
- `workflow.background` module to simplify launching background tasks (daemons)

name: Add diacritic folding
body:
## New features 
- `Workflow.filter()` now folds diacritics in search keys if `query` contains only ASCII characters, so that `boll` will match `Böll` etc.

## Changes 
- `Workflow.filter()` now defaults to `MATCH_ALL ^ MATCH_ALLCHARS` to provide more relevant results much more quickly.

## Bugfixes 
- Fixed a few typos in the documentation.
